login.welcome: Hello! Welcome to LabYoke. You are one step away from getting your chems!
search.title: Search.
search.description: Start your search by typing in the name of the reagent. You can also select your keyword from the dropdown.
search.catalogdescription: Start your search by typing in the catalog number. You can also select your keyword from the dropdown.
search.resultstitle: These Researchers and Labs can share your
search.tip.title: Need A Tip?
search.tip.desc:
You can either search by keyword or by catalog number.

By Keyword
You can either type the entirety or part of a reagent Or you can select a reagent from the drop down list available to you by clicking on the triangle inside the field. The list can be shortened if you start typing the name of the reagent you are looking for.
Click on Search to retrieve a list of reagents that you can order.

By Catalog Number
You can either type the entirety or part of a reagent Or you can select a reagent from the drop down list available to you by clicking on the triangle inside the field. The list can be shortened if you start typing the name of the reagent you are looking for.
Click on Search to retrieve a list of reagents that you can order.

Search results
The results displayed are of reagents currently marked as available and uploaded by an administrator.
Search results never contain your own reagents. Only the reagents outside of your inventory. You can manage your own inventory availability from the Shares page.

Order
Once you have decided on a reagent and location, click on the cart icon to order the reagent. An email will be sent to you and the owner of the reagent to fulfill the order.
about.desc1: The House Of Konate-Schib Foundation is a private foundation formed in 2017 by Gnagna Konate-Shaysh and Andria Schibler. Gnagna’s Foundation is funded entirely through profits and royalties from LabYoke research management software. The foundation believes that through philanthropy, we can make the world a better place.
about.desc2: Our first initiative is to make sure students have safe, affordable, adequate housing while attending university. We believe providing funding to help students secure reasonable living arrangements throughout their studies is a vital part of education and paves the way for future success. Student housing should not be the limiting factor during a person’s education and development.
about.desc3: Our second initiative is to provide funding for students who are capable and wish to pursue a career in either computer science or cell biology.
about.desc4: We believe providing educational funds is a great way to secure future technological developments which will allow communities to function in a safe, efficient, and healthier manner.
help.title: Help
help.subtitle: What is LabYoke?!
help.desc1: LabYoke is a web based software application that links multiple labs together within a department to share chemicals and reagents. Utilizing LabYoke will allow students and trainees to share lab reagents which will help lower costs and save time making experiments more efficient.
help.desc3: You have to come to the right place to share your chemicals with your colleagues in a fun and efficient environment.
help.desc5: Each department registers to use the web app. Each lab or group designates an administrator (lab manager or technician) who will upload an Excel file containing all of the chemicals and reagents ordered within the past 1-2 years. Each lab member within the department can create a user name and login to search through a cumulative department inventory before they make an order.
help.desc6: This generates a searchable inventory database linked with location and contact information which can be used to complete and experiment or procedure while you are waiting on a reagent or chemical to arrive or if you wish to try a product before you buy it. This database can also be used to identify chemicals, products and reagents which are routinely ordered and could possibly be ordered in bulk to save money by purchasing larger orders and reducing shipping costs.
help.desc7: This web app will also reduce institution wide emails requesting a reagent or help, allow people to use LabYoke as a social interface. The most important feature is that it can be used to reduce purchasing prices. A number of lab chemicals and reagents have an expiration date, and this will allow enzymes and perishable products to be used to completion through sharing. You can also use this web app to help identify items that you might want to consider buying in bulk to reduce shipping fees, or buying a larger quantity and sharing the reagent or chemical amongst the department. Lastly having an uploaded searchable database can also be used by environmental health and safety teams to identify potentially hazardous chemicals and biological reagents and link these purchases with a location.
help.desc9: , you can of course always reach us at:

reports.title: Reports.
reports.subtitle: Here are the reports that an administrator can generate and build a portfolio with. Please note that reports can only be generated using Chrome or Firefox browsers.
reports.tip.desc:
Select a report from the drop down menu. Fields are optional unless otherwise noted.

Parameters under Show will add additional columns to the report table.

All reports (except the Inventory Report Upload) are always restricted to your department data only.

account.team.name: Name
account.tip.desc:
Click on the pencil icon to open the field in edit mode. Make your desired change (or not) then click on the check icon to save.

Each field is individually saved.

Click on the Who's in your team button for a list of all the researchers in your department.

Language
All email communications are sent in your language of choice selected here.
orders.title: Orders.
orders.subtitle: You have not ordered any reagent yet! Click on the Search button and start labyoking!
orders.subdesc: Incredible! You have ordered the following reagents so far. Cancelled orders are listed if they cannot be fulfilled.
orders.chart.title: Operational Charts.
orders.chart.notes: The data generated by all orders accross the different labs in your department allow us to build these cool and informative charts that you might just be interested in. Select a chart above and start exploring!
orders.qty.title2: 's all time top 10 orders and shares.

orders.month.title: A Bar chart of the monthly orders.
orders.month.subtitle1: This bar chart depicts your number of orders this month (so far) per Reagent. Hover on top of a bar to display its value below.
orders.month.subtitle2: You have not ordered any reagent this month.
orders.month.subtitle3: A Bar chart of all orders in each lab.

orders.month.subtitle5: No reagent has been ordered in any lab so far.
orders.success.title: Great! You have ordered the following reagent from
orders.tip.desc:
This page is divided in 2 sections:

Your personal Orders
All reagents that you have ordered are listed. New orders are highlighted in light blue. Once the reagent owner has viewed the transaction, the status of the order is set to fulfilled. Cancelled orders that owners could not fulfill are highlighted in light bronze. For every cancelled order, you have received a cancellation email.

The table can be searched and sorted.

Operational Charts
A list of charts is available to visualize the data generated by the shared data.

The Bubble contains booster messages which celebrate your successes but also from time to time might warn you about your data trends.

shares.admin.success: Fantastic! You have uploaded the file:
shares.chart.title: Operational Charts.
shares.chart.notes: The data generated by all shares accross the different labs in your department allow us to build these cool and informative charts that you might just be interested in. Select a chart above and start exploring! Stay tuned... More charts to come.
shares.venn.title: A Venn chart of your all re-agents accross your department.
shares.venn.subtitle1: This venn graph depicts the cross-reagent in at most six labs within your department. You can search for a particular reagent from the search field below or print out
shares.venn.subtitle2: a CVS/Excel spreadsheet containing all data.
shares.all.title: A Line chart of your all time top 5 shares.
shares.all.subtitle: This line graph depicts your top 5 total number of shares per Reagent. Hover on top of a dot to display its value below.
shares.month.title: A Bar chart of your top 5 monthly shares.
shares.month.subtitle1: This bar graph depicts your top 5 number of shares this
shares.month.subtitle2: (so far) per Reagent. Hover on top of a bar to display its value below.
shares.month.none: You have not shared any reagent this month. If you have new chems to share, have your administrator upload them on your behalf and start saving money for your lab.
shares.venn.chart.table: Click on a diagram value to list reagents
shares.tip.desc:
This page is divided in 3 sections + 1 section for Administrators:

Your Reagents ordered by other researchers
When a researcher orders a reagent from your inventory, a row is added to the table to keep track of the transaction. New shares are highlighted in light blue.

If for any reason, you are unable to fulfill the order, you can click on the checkbox under the X column to send an email to the requestor and essentially cancel the order. Cancelled orders are highlighted in light bronze.

Your Reagents uploaded by your administrators
Your administrator is charged with replenishing your reagent inventory in LabYoke.
If you are running low on inventory for a particular reagent, click on the checkbox under the X column. Checked reagents will not be displayed in any search results thus cannot be ordered. You can always re-instate the reagent by checking it again.

Tables can be searched and sorted.

Operational Charts
A list of charts is available to visualize the data generated by the shared data.

Admin Upload
Administrators are tasked with uploading the inventory for all researchers in their department. This tool can be used upload an xcel spreadsheet and replenish/create reagents for reseachers.
